lines.author: Grandma
lines.text: It's not usual of you to seem so down. What's wrong?

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: I really don't feel like being here... And I'm so nervous Grandma! It's been so long since we had a party with this many guests! What if I make a fool of myself?

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: What if I sound awkward? Or what should I do if the guests don't even recognize me...

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: I can't bring myself to greet anyone like this... It's like I freeze in front of the guests...

lines.author: Grandma
lines.text: Listen, it's normal to feel a little bit anxious! But don't worry. Nothing can go wrong with greeting someone.

lines.author: Grandma
lines.text: In fact, it only makes people happy knowing that you took the time to say hello to them!

lines.author: Grandma
lines.text: No one will be upset at you. And if you make them laugh or smile with some awkwardness, isn't that a good thing?

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: I suppose I can see things that way...

lines.author: Grandma
lines.text: And about you feeling down... I don't know what happened, but remember Grandma will always be here for you.

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: Thank you Grandma! I know you're here for me. It's hard, but for you, I'll try to smile and greet the guests the best I can!

lines.author: Grandma
lines.text: I'm glad that I could help my dear. Grandma loves to see you smile.

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: (Grandma gave me a little bit of strength. I'll try and greet the other guests now...)
